# OSSignpostID

**Structure**

An identifier that disambiguates signposted intervals.

## Declaration

```swift
struct OSSignpostID
```

## Overview

Multiple intervals that have matching names, subsystems, and categories, and that exist in the same scope can be in-flight simultaneously. To match a pair of interval calls, you need to identify each interval with a unique signpost identifier. Use the first strategy in the list below that matches your use case:

- If identical intervals can never overlap, use the [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSSignpostID/exclusive] signpost ID.
- If you have data that uniquely identifies each instance of the measured task, create a signpost ID using the [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSSignpostID/init(_:)] method. The value you provide must not match that of any of the system-defined signpost IDs.
- If you have an object that uniquely identifies a pair of interval calls, such as the object you’re measuring, create a signpost ID using the [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSSignposter/makeSignpostID(from:)] method. Don’t use this method for signposts that cross process boundaries.
- Otherwise, create a signpost ID using the [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/OSSignposter/makeSignpostID()] method.

## Getting Signpost Identifiers

- **exclusive**: A signpost identifier that indicates no overlap among different signpost time intervals.
- **invalid**: A signpost identifier that indicates an error.
- **null**: A signpost identifier that indicates a disabled signpost.

## Creating a Signpost Identifier

- **init(_:)**: Creates a signpost ID from an arbitrary 64-bit integer value.
- **init(log:)**: Creates a signpost ID for the specified log.
- **init(log:object:)**: Creates a signpost ID and associates it with the specified object.

## Getting an Identifier’s Raw Value

- **rawValue**: The signpost ID’s raw value.

## Generating Signpost IDs

- **makeSignpostID()**: Returns an identifier that’s unique within the scope of the signposter.
- **makeSignpostID(from:)**: Returns an identifier that the signposter derives from the specified object.

## Conforms To

- Comparable
- Copyable
- Equatable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
